casebody.data:
Billy HAMILTON, Plaintiff-Appellant/Cross-Appellee,
v.
NORTHFIELD INSURANCE COMPANY, Defendant-Appellee/Cross-Appellant. Oklahoma Association for Justice, Amicus Curiae. Billy Hamilton, Plaintiff-Appellee,
v.
Northfield Insurance Company, Defendant-Appellant. No. 17-7049
No. 17-7055 United States Court of Appeals, Tenth Circuit. Filed January 17, 2019 Kris Ted Ledford, Ledford Law Firm, Owasso, OK, for Plaintiff-Appellant Jacob Daniel, Darrell W. Downs, Mark H. Ramsey, R. Stratton Taylor, Taylor Foster Law Firm, Claremore, OK, for Defendant-Appellee Simone Gosnell Fulmer, Fulmer Sill, Oklahoma City, OK, Justin Drew Houghton, Merlin Law Group, Oklahoma City, OK, Timothy B. Hummel, Timothy B. Hummel, Oklahoma City, OK, Rex Travis, Travis Law Office, Oklahoma City, OK, for Amicus Curiae Oklahoma Association for Justice Before TYMKOVICH, Chief Judge, McKAY, and CARSON, Circuit Judges.

ORDER

Notwithstanding our January 17, 2019 order sua sponte granting panel rehearing and vacating our December 18, 2018 opinion in 17-7049, we clarify that the opinion remains in effect as to the issues raised and resolved in 17-7055. The Clerk shall issue the mandate in 17-7055 forthwith. As stated in in our January 17, 2019 order, 17-7049 is reopened and remains abated.
